column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Gotō Islands
#Text=Gotō Islands （五島） are an archipielago in Nagasaki Prefecture , Japan .
#Text=Regions
#Text=The five main islands that give name to the archipielago are ( from South to North ) :
#Text=Fukue ( 福江島 , Fukuejima ) .
#Text=Biggest island both in extension and population .
#Text=Hisaka ( 久賀島 , Hisakajima ) .
#Text=Naru ( 奈留島 , Narushima ) .
#Text=Wakamatsu ( 若松島 , Wakamatsujima ) .
#Text=Nakadori ( 中通島 , Nakadorijima ) .
#Text=Cities
#Text=Fukue City in the island of the same name is the most populous , with over 10,000 inhabitants .
#Text=Understand
#Text=" Gotō " means " Five Islands " .
#Text=When they started spreading Christianity in Japan , priests were particularly successful in Gotō .
#Text=Even when a ban on religion entered in effect , many believers did not change their faith and continued worshipping secretly for two centuries .
#Text=After the ban on Christianity was lifted on the 18th Century , many churches were constructed .
#Text=They constitute one of the main attractions of Gotō , along with its beautiful nature and fresh produce , especially fish .
#Text=Talk
#Text=If you speak to older people , you may be able to hear a little of Gotō dialect .
#Text=It has some interesting variations not found in Nagasaki dialect , like :
#Text=- Min ( 水 ) : water
#Text=- Min ( 右 ) : right
#Text=- Min ( 耳 ) : ear
#Text=- Gesakka ( げさっか ) :
#Text=vulgar or lewd person
#Text=- Baraka ( ばらか ) :
#Text=violent person , courage
#Text=- Bittsunmijoka ( びっつんみじょか ) : cute , beautiful
#Text=The Loco shop specializes in T-shirts with Gotō-ben .
#Text=It 's at Ikedamachi 2-14 , one minute left from the castle bridge .
#Text=Get in
#Text=You can get to Gotō by slow ferry , fast jet foil and airplane .
#Text=Ferry
#Text=It takes 3 hr 30 min from Nagasaki to Fukue , but it also stops at other islands .
#Text=The cost is ¥ 2280 for adults second class , one way . ( You can only purchase a roundtrip if you depart from the islands . ) Children pay half price .
#Text=As of April 2011 , the normal times ( except Obon in mid August and ship reparations in mid April ) are :
#Text=Ships depart between 10 min ( Naru , Narao ) and 20 min ( Fukue ) after arriving .
#Text=From April 6 to 16 , there is no ship departing at 08:00 from Nagasaki .
#Text=There are also ships sailing to Kami-Gotō ( north of the islands ) from Sasebo .
#Text=You can find their updated timetables in Japanese at their . homepage
#Text=Jet foil
#Text=It takes 85 min . from Nagasaki to Fukue , and the cost is ¥ 6630 for adults , one way .
#Text=The time table varies depending on the season , from 2 sailings/day in February to 5-7 sailings/day in summer .
#Text=The 07:40 and 11:30 sailings stay unchanged all year ( except from Jan 7 to Feb 4t , which has 07:40 and 14:25 ) .
#Text=You can find their updated timetables in Japanese at their homepage .
#Text=Airplane
#Text=In only 30 minutes you can fly with Oriental Air Bridge from Nagasaki to Fukue Airport for ¥ 11300 , one way , and ¥ 19500 , round trip .
#Text=Flight schedule varies greatly depending on the dates ( 1 to 3 daily flights either way ) .
#Text=Check their homepage ( Japanese only ) .
#Text=See
#Text=Fukue
#Text=Stay safe
#Text=While even Fukue City can get very dark at night due to no lighting , Gotō is as safe or more as the rest of Japan .
#Text=Exercise basic caution and you´ll be fine .
#Text=Go next
#Text=Your only choice to continue your trip is to get back to the Japanese mainland , either Nagasaki or Sasebo , by boat or plane .
